title: 107_s1775
content: The Act titled "Agroterrorism Prevention Act of 2001" addresses plant enterprise terrorism. The Act titled "Agroterrorism Prevention Act of 2001" addresses plant enterprise terrorism by amending Section 43 of title 18, United States Code to include plants in the definition of terrorism related to animal or plant enterprises. The Act "Agroterrorism Prevention Act of 2001" amends Section 43 of title 18, United States Code to include plants in the definition of terrorism related to animal or plant enterprises. This includes a detailed definition of the term 'plant' to encompass various plant materials used for propagation. The beginning of chapter 3 of title 18, United States Code, related to section 43 is amended. SEC 3. ENHANCEMENT OF PENALTIES FOR ANIMAL AND PLANT ENTERPRISE TERRORISM. Section 43 of title 18, United States Code is amended to increase penalties for maliciously damaging or destroying property of animal or plant enterprises using fire or explosives. Offenders face imprisonment for 5 to 20 years, fines, or both. Section 43 of title 18, United States Code is amended to increase penalties for damaging property of animal or plant enterprises. Offenders face imprisonment for life, for any term of years, or death. SEC. 4 amends Section 1961(1) of title 18, US Code by including animal and plant enterprise terrorism. SEC. 5 establishes a National Agroterrorism Incident Clearing-House. The Director will establish a national clearinghouse for information on incidents of crime and terrorism related to animal, plant enterprises, commercial activities impacting the environment, or individuals connected to these activities. The clearinghouse will accept and maintain information submitted by various law enforcement agencies. The national clearinghouse for information on incidents of crime and terrorism related to animal, plant enterprises, and commercial activities impacting the environment will collect, index, and provide information to law enforcement agencies for investigation purposes. The information will include details of the incident, suspects or perpetrators, and any other relevant information. The clearinghouse for crime and terrorism related to animal, plant enterprises, and environmental impact will be user-friendly for law enforcement agencies. The Director will publicize its existence and may utilize resources from other government departments or accept assistance from private organizations. Coordination with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms will be ensured. Definitions for terms like "animal or plant enterprise" will be consistent with existing laws. Authorization of Appropriations for fiscal years 2002 through 2007 is provided for the implementation of this section, with necessary funds to be allocated. The term "Director" refers to the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. SEC. 6. ANIMAL AND PLANT RESEARCH SECURITY PROGRAMS. The Director shall award grants to colleges and universities for security improvements and develop a security report on animal and plant enterprise terrorism threats. Eligibility for grants requires submission of an application by the college or university. In this section, colleges and universities must submit an application to the Director of the National Science Foundation for grants related to security needs. Priority is given to institutions with the highest security needs. $5,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year 2002 and 2003 for this purpose.
